core

Class TextHighlighted

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.UserAction
      • core.TextHighlighted

  • public class TextHighlighted
extends UserAction
    Listen for any text highlighted and stores it immediately. Can be created by behaviors using UserActionFactory.
    Author:
    csiki

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String highlightedString
      The highlighted text.
      private core.HighlightTracker highlightTracker
      HighlightTracker instance.
      private boolean textHighlighted
      True if text has been highlighted when activated, false otherwise.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate(Behavior behavior)
      Activates TextHighlighted, so it listens for text highlighted.
      void deactivate()
      Deactivates TextHighlighted, so it won't listen for text highlighted.

      Gets the highlighted text (if any has been highlighted since activated).

    • Method Detail

      • getHighlightedText

        public java.lang.String getHighlightedText()
        Gets the highlighted text (if any has been highlighted since activated).
        Returns:
        highlighted text or null if nothing has been highlighted since activated.

      • isTextHighlighted

        public boolean isTextHighlighted()
        Gets if a text is highlighted since activated.
        Returns:
        true if text is highlighted since activated, false otherwise.

      • update

        public void update()
        HighlightTracker calls it if new key is hit. Behavior should NOT call it!
        Specified by:
        update in class UserAction

      • activate

        public void activate(Behavior behavior)
        Activates TextHighlighted, so it listens for text highlighted. Should be activated after created by behavior!
        Specified by:
        activate in class UserAction

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Deactivates TextHighlighted, so it won't listen for text highlighted. Can be called by behavior but automatically called by itself if the expected key is hit (after had been activated ofc.).
        Specified by:
        deactivate in class UserAction
